intro: Vincetoxicum hainanense, commonly known as the Hainan false bindweed, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pink flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Vincetoxicum hainanense is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along stream banks.
